articles.title: US Envoy Bosworth Here
articles.content:
US Envoy Bosworth Here
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Stephen Bosworth, U.S. special representative for North Korea policy, and his party arrived here by air on Tuesday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets DR Congo Gov. Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets DR Congo Gov. Delegation
Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the government delegation of the Democratic Republic of Congo headed by Ignace Gata Mavita, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.

articles.title: Personal Message from DR Congo President
articles.content:
Personal Message from DR Congo President
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a personal message and a gift by Joseph Kabila, president of the Democratic Republic of Congo.
					 They were handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Tuesday by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Ignace Gata Mavita who is heading the government delegation of Democratic Congo on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Namibian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Namibian President
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a congratulatory message to Hifikepunye Pohamba upon his reelection as president of Namibia.
					 Kim in the message noted that the Korean people sincerely rejoice over much progress and development made by the Namibian people in the socio-economic field under the leadership of the president.
					
					 Expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Namibia would grow stronger in the future, Kim wished the president fresh success in his work for the prosperity of the country and its people's welfare.

articles.title: Japanese Study of Juche Delegation Here
articles.content:
Japanese Study of Juche Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Japanese Society for the Study of the Juche Idea headed by Sakae Araki, deputy director general of the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism, arrived here by air on Tuesday.

articles.title: People's Security Ministry Gives Performances
articles.content:
People's Security Ministry Gives Performances
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Performances were given by the art squad of the Ministry of People's Security in different cities and counties of North Phyongan and Jagang Provinces.
					 The performances were enjoyed by leading officials of party, power and economic bodies and working people's organizations and working people of different strata in local areas.
					
					 Put on the stages of the performances which began with mixed chorus "We Have Longed for You, General" were colorful pieces demonstrating the might of the interior forces that have grown strong under the leadership of the great brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu and firmly defended the forefront of the class struggle, glorifying the tradition of devotedly defending the leader for over six decades.
					
					 The performers impressively represented their great honor and self-respect as people's security men who live and struggle as revolutionary soldiers faithful to the party and the leader and reliable defenders of the people in such numbers as real story "Echo of Life", Oungum ensemble "The General Star beyond the Clouds" and trumpet and female solo "Soldiers Live near the General".
					
					 They showed well the firm faith and will of the people's security men to share intention and destiny with Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il and breathe the same air with him for all ages as well as to successfully fulfill the mission and duty as frontline unit in the class struggle in such pieces as male guitar quintet ensemble "Let's Defend Socialism" and choral recitation of poem "Long Journey for Devotedly Defending the Leader".
					
					 They also gave a performance at the construction site of Huichon Power Station No. 2.

articles.title: Hyangsan Souvenir Factory
articles.content:
Hyangsan Souvenir Factory
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Situated at the foot of Mt. Myohyang, one of the six famous mountains of Korea, is a factory making souvenirs for local and foreign tourists. 
					 The factory produces tens of thousands of woodcraft pieces of several dozen kinds every year. It has steadily improved their shapes and quality to attract more tourists.
					
					 Among them there are mortar, vase, seasoning pot, gallipot, owl-shaped toothpick holder, pencil stand and pillow, made of oak tree and Maackia amurensis.
					
					 In tourist seasons all counters of shops in the resort are crowded with people seeking souvenirs.
					
					 The factory is now pushing ahead with various projects to boost the production.

articles.title: Midget Hydraulic Turbine
articles.content:
Midget Hydraulic Turbine
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A midget impulse turbine has been invented by the DPRK State Academy of Sciences.
					 With this turbine, called hydraulic generator, it is possible to produce 400-watt electricity to the maximum out of a small amount of water flowing down in mountains and valleys 3-10 liters per second with a water head as high as five meters.
					
					 It, simple in structure and high in generating capacity, does not need incidental equipment such as governor, accelerator and transformer.
					
					 It is well received as an effective "small hydraulic power station".

articles.title: Fatherland Liberation War Historic Site
articles.content:
Fatherland Liberation War Historic Site
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- There is a Historic Site Associated with the Fatherland Liberation War in the suburbs of Pyongyang.
					 President Kim Il Sung had the Supreme Command stationed at the site from January Juche 40 (1951) to the last period of the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953) and led the war to victory by wisely guiding the military, political, economic, cultural and all other affairs of the country. 
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il stayed at the site from late June to mid-August 1952. During the days, he learnt from the President's Juche-oriented military tactics and art of command, cultivating a noble spirit of loving the country, the nation and the people.
					
					 Grasping the profound truth that the embrace of the motherland is precisely that of the President, he also created the famous song "The Embrace of My Motherland", the first paean to the motherland, consistent with the revolutionary outlook on the leader.
					
					 Placed in the center of the site is the headquarters of the Supreme Command furnished with an office room, library, etc.
					
					 The President told his son a story about two pistols handed over by Kim Hyong Jik and gave him one of them at the headquarters on July 10, 1952.
					
					 That day was the 58th birth anniversary of Kim Hyong Jik, the father of the President.
					
					 Implicated in the pistol were the earnest request the President made to his son for the accomplishment of the Korean people's just cause with arms and Kim Jong Il's firm pledge to further glorify the country with the victory of the Songun-based revolution.
					
					 Preserved to the original state at the site are more than 70 places. Among them are an operations room where the President formulated many operation and battle plans to smash frantic moves of the U.S. imperialists including their "summer and autumn offensives" and "new offensive", subterranean passages, the place where he talked with heroes of the Republic and model soldiers on June 29, 1951, the place where he had a picture taken after receiving the title of the DPRK's marshal on February 7, 1953 and a spring.
					
					 On display at the site are gifts sent to him by local and foreign people, an unexploded heavy bomb and marks of bullets dropped and fired from US aircraft and 1,260-odd pieces of historic relics.
					
					 The Fatherland Liberation War Museum and a monument to the revolutionary exploits of the President standing at the site give a glimpse into the history of Korea advancing triumphantly under the banner of Songun.
					
					 Hundreds of thousands of servicemen and people of Korea, overseas Koreans and foreigners visit the historic site, exhibitive of the Songun-based leadership of commanders of Mt. Paektu, every year.

articles.title: US Aim Sought in Tightening Its Alliance with Japan Disclosed
articles.content:
US Aim Sought in Tightening Its Alliance with Japan Disclosed
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Commander of the U.S. forces in Japan Rice was reported to have blustered recently that there would be no such happening as the U.S.-Japan alliance would be affected by the transfer of the U.S. military base in Futemma, Ginowan, Okinawa Prefecture, when interviewed by foreign press, asserting that the "U.S.-Japan alliance is very strong" and "it is possible to settle the issue of the said transfer in the direction of boosting the bilateral relations."
					 Commenting on this, a news analyst of Minju Joson Tuesday says this indicates that the U.S. is very uneasy about the stand and attitude of the present Japanese government and the people of Okinawa Prefecture toward the issue.
					
					 Since the Democratic Party of Japan came to power, the Japanese side has raised a new issue of transferring the above-said military base outside Okinawa Prefecture or abroad under the strong pressure of its people, the news analyst notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is the U.S. calculation that if such situation is allowed to go on, this will affect the existence of the U.S.-Japan alliance and, furthermore, its attempt to use Japan as a shock brigade in carrying out its strategy for dominating Asia-Pacific will end in smoke.
					
					 The U.S. underscored "the importance of tightening the U.S.-Japan alliance" out of the fear that this happening may result in losing both a close friend Japan in carrying out the above-said strategy and an important military strategic base of its forces in East Asia.
					
					 This indicates that the U.S. remains unchanged in its wild ambition to establish a military domination over Asia-Pacific with the help of Japan.
					
					 The U.S. forces' presence in Japan encroaches upon the interests of not only Japan but its neighboring countries and constitutes a main factor of disturbing peace and stability.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to pull its aggressor forces out of East Asia at once as unanimously demanded by its people.

articles.title: Vigilance against Imperialists' Proxy War Called for
articles.content:
Vigilance against Imperialists' Proxy War Called for
Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Every country and nation are bound to suffer disasters if they fail to be vigilant against a war by proxy waged under the patronage and wirepulling of the imperialists, warns Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a signed article.
					It goes on:
					
					The direct and undisguised armed aggression against sovereign states betrays the imperialist's ferocious nature while the war by proxy launched by their stooges discloses their crafty nature. 
					
					One may comment that most of the world-wide disputes in the period of the Cold War were the product of the stand-off between the U.S. and the former Soviet Union. 
					
					The war by proxy fought by the U.S. became more destructive against the background that the structure of the Cold War, ie the confrontation between the two superpowers, was destroyed at a time and there emerged power vacuum in different parts of the world. Herein lies its dangerous and grave nature. 
					
					The Mideast is a major theatre of the U.S. war by proxy at present.
					
					The U. S. is driving Israel as a shock brigade for the war by proxy by giving it huge military assistance in a bid to carry out the U.S. strategy for dominating the Mideast. 
					
					The imperialists zealously hurl the forces of their satellite countries into the war by proxy. Then they employ the method of directly launching armed invasion, availing themselves of this opportunity. 
					
					The imperialists' much touted "mediation" precisely means intervention and aggression and their loudmouthed "peace" is a prelude to a war. 
					
					It is the truth proved by history and the reality that if a country dances to the tune of the imperialists, taken in by their talk about "peace," this is bound to entail irrevocable disastrous consequences.
					
					Some countries' dispatch of more combat forces to other countries, yielding to the U.S. pressure for additional troop dispatch to Afghanistan, is little short of forcing their soldiers to fall victim to the U.S. war by proxy. 
					
					One should not forget even a moment that the imperialists' "peace offensive" is always accompanied by savage aggression and military intervention, warns the article.

articles.title: White Paper on Violation of Human Rights Released in S. Korea
articles.content:
White Paper on Violation of Human Rights Released in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Bar Association for Democratic Society in south Korea made public a "white paper on the violation of human rights of Ssangyong Motors."
					 The more than 600 page white paper reportedly deals with the harsh human rights abuses perpetrated by the authorities and the management side on the basis of what lawyers affiliated to the above-said bar association and the joint council of the human rights organizations and human rights activists recorded on the scene of the 77 day-long strike waged by the unionists of Ssangyong Motors in defence of their right to existence.
					
					 It gives a detailed account of a report on the truth behind human rights abuses and press conferences, the law on the violation of human rights, a recommendation as regards human rights, accusation and indictment against Ssangyong Motors and data on the emergency relief operation of the "Human Rights Committee", articles of media, etc.

articles.title: Repeal of Fascist Law Urged by S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Repeal of Fascist Law Urged by S. Korean Organization
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters of Struggle against Dictatorship of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea released a statement on Dec. 4, 61 years since the fabrication of the "National Security Law".
					 The statement referred to a document laying bare the suppression perpetrated on the strength of the fascist law, which was issued by the People's Solidarity for the Repeal of the "National Security Law".
					
					 Recalling that the office of the Jeju Youth Society for Reunification and the house of its former leading member were forcibly searched,  the permanent representative and the secretary general of the Jeju Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration were booked without detention and indicted and penal servitude was imposed upon a religionist for posting on Internet articles and animation files praising the north, etc, the statement noted that these are part of the crackdown perpetrated by the authorities this year on charges of violation of the above-said evil law.
					
					 Pointing out that Yun Ki Jin, chairman of the South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification, and a member of the solidarity and others were sentenced to heavy penalties on charges of violating the evil law and are now serving prison terms, the statement held that all this is a tragedy spawned by the present regime.
					
					 The statement deplored that a large crowd of people are falling victim to the NSL, a leftover of the old era, still today when the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration should be sincerely implemented.
					
					 Noting that the NSL is, indeed, an evil law blocking reunification and abusing human rights which should be repealed without fail, the statement declared that youth and students would wage a dynamic anti-"government" struggle to get the fascist law abolished for the freedom of thinking and conscience and justice.

articles.title: DPRK Important Day Marked in Russia
articles.content:
DPRK Important Day Marked in Russia
Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held on Dec. 3 under the sponsorship of the United Confederation of Koreans in Russia on the occasions of the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 92nd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine.
					Speeches were made there by Vice-Chairman of the confederation Pak Myong San and others. 
					
					Speakers said that during nearly two decades since Kim Jong Il's assumption of the KPA supreme commandership on December 24, 1991 his greatness as a brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu has been fully displayed, noting that the KPA has reliably grown to be an invincible and elite strong army under his loving care.
					
					Referring to the fact that he is an iron-willed brilliant commander with matchless grit and pluck who brings enemies to their knees without firing even a single bullet, they stressed that the army and people of the DPRK will always emerge victorious under his leadership.
					
					Saying that December 24 marks the 92nd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, they praised her immortal revolutionary exploits. 
					
					After embarking upon the road of the revolutionary struggle in her early years Kim Jong Suk came to win fame as an anti-Japanese heroine in the course of waging the protracted and arduous struggle for the liberation of the country and devoted her all to upholding the cause of President Kim Il Sung for nation-building, they said. 
					
					Her desire was just to turn Korea into a country, powerful and prosperous, in which the people live with nothing to desire more in the world, they stated, adding:
					
					Her exploits will shine forever along with socialist Korea which takes on more beautiful looks as the days go by advancing towards 2012, towards a thriving nation.

articles.title: Key to Solving Problems Should Be Found among Masses
articles.content:
Key to Solving Problems Should Be Found among Masses
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- One day in January, Juche 64 (1975), General Secretary
					 Kim Jong Il met an official of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea.
					 After acquainting himself with a work plan drawn up by the federation, he said he thought it was well done. Then he asked the official if it was elaborated through discussion with workers.
					
					 Puzzled by such an unexpected question, the official could find no word in reply.
					
					 After a while, the leader said the key to solving problems should be found among masses so that it would be advisable to discuss the plan with workers.
					
					 Encouraged by his advice, the official immediately went to a factory to have a discussion with workers over the program.

articles.title: En Pyongyang Stephen Bosworth y su comitivae
articles.content:
En Pyongyang Stephen Bosworth y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Llegaron el dia 8 a esta capital por via aerea Stephen Bosworth, representante especial de Estados Unidos para la politica sobre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, y su comitiva.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe carta y presente de Joseph Kabila
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe carta y presente de Joseph Kabila
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio la carta personal y presente que le dirigiera el presidente de la Republica Democratica del Congo, Joseph Kabila.
					El vicecanciller Ignace Gata Mavita, jefe de la delegacion gubernamental de la RDC, de visita en Corea, los entrego el dia 8 al presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Kim Yong Nam.

articles.title: Funcion del grupo de propaganda artistica del MINSEP
articles.content:
Funcion del grupo de propaganda artistica del MINSEP
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El grupo de propaganda artistica del Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo ofrecio su funcion en varias ciudades y distritos de las provincias de Phyong-an del Norte y de Jagang.
					 La presenciaron los funcionarios directivos de los organos del partido, el Poder y la economia y las organizaciones de masas y los trabajadores de distintos sectores en dichas localidades.
					
					 En las escenas iniciadas con el coro mixto "Quisimos mucho ver al General", se pusieron variadas piezas que manifiestan el poderio del ejercito interior que crecio fuertemente en el regazo del gran comandante distinguido del Paektu y ha defendido firmemente la linea avanzada de la lucha clasista haciendo brillar la tradicion de defensa a ultranza al Lider de mas de 60 anos.
					
					 En el relato verdadero "El eco de vida", la cancion con acompanamiento de Oungum "Al Lucero General, mas alla de las nubes" y la trompeta y solo femenino "Al lado del General viven los soldados", los ejecutantes describieron bien el gran orgullo y dignidad de los integrantes de cuerpo de la seguridad publica que viven y luchan como soldados revolucionarios files al partido y el Lider y fidedignos defensores del pueblo.
					
					 Ademas, en el quinteto masculino de guitarra "Defendamos el socialismo", la poesia a coro "Largo camino de la defensa a costa de la vida" y otras piezas, demostraron bien la ferrea conviccion y voluntad de los miembros de cuerpo de la seguridad publica de cumplir la mision y el deber de la primera unidad en la lucha clasista compartiendo siempre con el Comandante Supremo el proposito, el aliento y el destino.
					
					Tambien se realizo la misma funcion en el lugar de construccion de la Central hidroelectrica de Huichon No.2.

articles.title: Minju Joson comenta la entrevista de comandante norteamericano en Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson comenta la entrevista de comandante norteamericano en Japon
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- En su reciente entrevista con la prensa extranjera, Rice, comandante de las tropas norteamericanas estacionadas en Japon, se refirio al problema de traslado de la base militar de Futemma en la ciudad de Ginowan del departamento de Okinawa.
					 En esa ocasion el hizo hincapie en que no se aflojara la alianza EE.UU.-Japon por ese problema diciendo que esta es "muy solida" y "podra solucionar el problema de traslado de la base en direccion al fortalecimiento de las relaciones mutuas".
					
					 Esto demuestra que EE.UU. esta muy inquieto por la posicion y actitud del actual gobierno japones y la poblacion del departamento de Okinawa en cuanto a ese problema.
					
					 Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del dia 8 y continua:
					
					Despues de la toma del Poder por parte del Partido Democratico, la parte japonesa plantea la mudanza de la base en cuestion a las afueras de Okinawa o de Japon obedeciendo a la fuerte demanda de los habitantes de este departamento.
					
					 EE.UU. piensa que si se desarrolla asi la situacion, sera afectada la alianza con Japon y resultara frustrado su intento de usar a este pais como brigada de choque en el cumplimiento de la estrategia de dominar a Asia y el Pacifico.
					
					Preocupado de perder a Japon, aliado fuerte en el cumplimiento de dicha estrategia e importante punto militar y estrategico de las  tropas norteamericanas en Asia oriental, el imperio invento la teoria de la "importancia del fortalecimiento de la alianza EE.UU.-Japon".
					
					Esto demuestra que es invariable la ambicion de EE.UU. de erigirse como dominante militar de la region de Asia y el Pacifico con la ayuda de Japon.
					
					 La presencia de las tropas norteamericanas en Japon perjudica los intereses de este pais isleno y los otros del contorno, siendo el factor principal de la perturbacion de la paz y la estabilidad.
					
					 EE.UU. debe sacar de inmediato de Asia oriental a sus fuerzas armadas agresoras segun la unanime voluntad y demanda de los pueblos regionales.
